channel.title: webshell on hg8's Notes
channel.description: Recent content in webshell on hg8's Notes

item.title: Bitlab - HackTheBox
item.description: Bitlab box was an interesting box, user part was typical real-life scenario (actually meet this scenario during a pentest) while the root part was my first time Reverse Engineering. First we add the box ip to our hosts file and let’s start! $ echo "10.10.10.114 bitlab.htb" >> /etc/hosts User flag. Let’s start with the classic nmap scan: nmap -sV -sT -sC bitlab.htb Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2019-10-26 02:00 CEST PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 7.

item.title: Networked - HackTheBox
item.description: Networking was an interesting box. Focused on coding mistakes rather than exploit or misconfiguration. First thing first, let’s add the box IP to the hosts file: $ echo "10.10.10.146 networked.htb" >> /etc/hosts Let’s go ! User Flag Recon Let’s start with the classic nmap scan: $ nmap -sV -sT -sC networked.htb Starting Nmap 7.80 ( https://nmap.org ) at 2019-10-19 19:47 CEST Nmap scan report for networked.htb (10.10.10.146) PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION 22/tcp open ssh OpenSSH 7.
